myopenmath.statement:
A movie theater company wants to see if there is a difference in the variance of movie ticket sales in New Orleans and Dallas per week. They sample 17 sales from New Orleans (group 1) and 18 sales from Dallas (group 2) and count the number of tickets sold over a week. Test the claim using a significance level of \displaystyle\alpha =0.01. Assume that movie sales are normally distributed.
New OrleansDallas

Based on the hypotheses, compute the following:
Round answers to at least 4 decimal places.
The test statistic is =
The left tail critical value is =
The right-tail critical value is =
The decision is to
Fail to reject the null hypothesis
Reject the claim
Reject the null hypothesis
Accept the alternative hypothesis
.
The correct summary would be:
There is enough evidence to reject the claim
There is not enough evidence to reject the claim
There is not enough evidence to support the claim
There is enough evidence to support the claim
that there is a difference in the variance of movie ticket sales in New Orleans and Dallas per week.

ul.li: A: Fail to reject the null hypothesis
C: There is not enough evidence to support the claim
